original_data.question: A 17-year-old girl is referred by her dentist for a suspected eating disorder. She has been visiting the same dentist since childhood and for the past 2 years has had at least 2 visits for dental caries. She eventually admitted to him that she regularly induces vomiting by putting her fingers down her throat. She says she has been doing this for the last few years and purging at least once a week. More recently, she has been inducing emesis more often and even looked into diuretics as she feels that she is gaining more and more weight compared to her ‘skinny friends’. Her BMI is at the 50th percentile for her age and sex. Which of the following features is most consistent with this patient’s condition?

options.A: Patients with this disorder are not further sub-typed
options.B: Patients do not usually initiate treatment
options.C: Patients can have a history of both anorexia and bulimia
options.D: Patients will typically have a BMI between 17–18.5 kg/m2

model_response:
The patient in question is showing features of bulimia nervosa. This disorder is characterized by recurrent episodes of uncontrollable excessive eating (binge eating) followed by compensatory behavior to prevent weight gain such as self-induced vomiting, misuse of laxatives, diuretics, or other medications, fasting or excessive exercise. The binge eating and inappropriate compensatory behaviors both occur, on average, at least twice a week for 3 months. Self-induced vomiting is the most common compensatory behavior. Patients with this disorder are not further sub-typed. Patients do not usually initiate treatment. Patients can have a history of both anorexia and bulimia. Patients will typically have a BMI between 17–18.5 kg/m2.

Answer: OPTION A IS CORRECT.</s><s>

question_entities.definition: Human females as cultural, psychological, sociological, political, and economic entities.

The act of going to see some person or place or thing; it can cover a short or long period but refers to a non-permanent arrangement.

Localized destruction of the tooth surface initiated by decalcification of the enamel followed by enzymatic lysis of organic structures and leading to cavity formation. If left unchecked, the cavity may penetrate the enamel and dentin and reach the pulp.
**Description:**The patient has been admitted to a care facility and their community medications are suspended until hospital discharge.

The forcible expulsion of the contents of the STOMACH through the MOUTH.
Four or five slender jointed digits in humans and primates, attached to each HAND.

A funnel-shaped fibromuscular tube that conducts food to the ESOPHAGUS, and air to the LARYNX and LUNGS. It is located posterior to the NASAL CAVITY; ORAL CAVITY; and LARYNX, and extends from the SKULL BASE to the inferior border of the CRICOID CARTILAGE anteriorly and to the inferior border of the C6 vertebra posteriorly. It is divided into the NASOPHARYNX; OROPHARYNX; and HYPOPHARYNX (laryngopharynx).
A period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period.
Any period of seven consecutive days.

Agents that promote the excretion of urine through their effects on kidney function.
Emotional sensations.
The mass or quantity of heaviness of an individual. It is expressed by units of pounds or kilograms.
Persons whom one knows, likes, and trusts.
How long something has existed; elapsed time since birth.
The sexual union of a male and a female, a term used for human only.
Discrete protein structural units that may fold independently of the rest of the protein and have their own functions.
Marked by a reasonable or logical relation of parts and holding together as a harmonious or credible whole.
